project_abstract.cdata: The electric power distribution part of the project consists of the expansion of the distribution system during the two-year period 1967-68 and includes the installation of 230 MVA of primary and 250 MVA of secondary distribution transformers, 145 miles of primary distribution cable and secondary distribution equipment. The water supply part of the project includes the construction of a new Seletar dam and reservoir, expansion of the Woodleigh Treatment Plant and extension of the water distribution system through 1970. Total cost is estimated at $16 million and the proposed loan will cover the presently estimated foreign exchange cost of $8 million or half of the estimated total cost.
